The kernel ensures input tensors are contiguous to guarantee coalesced global memory access.
The kernel avoids using __ldg for parameter loads, relying on hardware coalescing for warp-wide broadcasts of the same value.
The kernel uses straightforward index calculations that compile to efficient bitwise operations for power-of-two dimensions.
The kernel minimizes the use of explicit intrinsics (e.g., __ldg, fmaf) to reduce register pressure and improve compiler optimization flexibility.
